citeinfo.origin:
Ocean Hemisphere Network Project (OHP)
Japan Agency for Marine-Earth Science and Technology (JAMSTEC)
citeinfo.title: JAMSTEC Western Pacific Seismic Data (PACIFIC 21)

abstract.p: Pacific21 is a generic name for the geophysical observation network in the Western Pacific region operated by research institutions in Japan. Operation of the network is coordinated by the committee for global geophysical observation under the Science Council of Japan. Observed data are distributed through each research institution and Global Network Data Center of IFREE/JAMSTEC.
Available data include broadband seismic data, synthetic seismographic data, geomagnetic and geoelectric data, geodetic data. All are available

Data policy: The data of the Institute for Frontier Research on Earth Evolution (IFREE), the Japan Agency for Marine-Earth Science and Technology (JAMSTEC) are originally provided by the Ocean Hemisphere Network Project (OHP). The data provided by OHP can be used only for the scientific purpose. At the presentation of data analyses and results, users are requested to show the origin of the data as OHP and IFREE/JAMSTEC explicitly. In no event shall the IFREE/JAMSTEC be liable to any party for damages arising out of the use of this software and data.

descript.purpose: To provide freely seismic, geoelectromagnetic, and geodetic data to the public.

idinfo.useconst: See data policy or contact Source.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
